column2: Research and Analysis:         -Conduct comprehensive reviews and analyses of existing mCDR technologies     -Stay updated on the latest developments, advancements, and research findings in the field.             Strategy Development:       -Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop innovative and effective strategies for diatom-based mCDR implementation.     -Tailor strategies to address specific environmental challenges and opportunities in different locations             Feasibility Assessment:       -Evaluate the feasibility of implementing diatom-based mCDR in targeted locations, considering environmental, regulatory, and logistical factors.     -Identify potential risks and mitigation strategies.             Collaboration and Networking:       -Establish and maintain collaborative relationships with international researchers, environmental organizations, and relevant stakeholders.     -Participate in conferences, workshops, and events to share knowledge and insights.             Documentation and Reporting:       -Prepare detailed reports and documentation on research findings, strategies, and implementation plans.     -Communicate research outcomes effectively to internal and external stakeholders.             Remote Project Management:       -Work independently in a remote setting, managing research projects and meeting project timelines.     -Collaborate with a global team to ensure coordinated efforts and successful implementation.             Qualifications:       -You have a Ph.D. or equivalent degree in Biotechnology, Marine Biology, Marine Sciences, Biology, Environmental Sciences, or a related field.       -You have proven expertise in diatom-based ocean and/or marine CDR research, with a track record of published work.         -You have strong analytical and research skills.      -You are an excellent written and verbal communicator.      -You possess experience in developing and implementing environmental strategies is highly desirable.      -You can work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment.          Additional Information:       -A chance to be a changemaker by contributing towards the groundbreaking environmental solutions that combat climate change and restore ecosystems     -See the direct results of your work in making a positive difference for the planet     -Join a pioneering organization with potential for career advancement.
column11: Biotechnology, Networking, Project management, Analytical, Biology, Research, Management, Strategy development

column2: As    Control Engineer / Protection Engineer    at IDC-HVDC- CONTROL PLATFORM (UB), Chennai you will be responsible for design, development, testing of Base control applications for Classic and Light HVDC system and also would be responsible to develop and maintain the base FST lab at Chennai     As a Control engineer at Base team you are expected to train the control and protection engineers and new team members on base applications and control concepts     To fulfill the current and future requirements of Hitachi s High Voltage DC (HVDC) transmission, Hitachi has developed a fully computerized control and protection system using state-of-the-art computers, micro-controllers and Digital Signal Processors connected by high performance industrial standard buses and fiber optic communication links     This system called as MACH, is the most advanced and highest performing HVDC control system in the market and has gradually evolved to an unequaled installed base around the world     To keep up with the demanding needs of HVDC customers and the market, we need to have a base for the MACH control and protection system     To be a part of this base development team one would need the skills below                 Must have Skills:           Deep Knowledge in HVDC Classic and Light Control / Protection applications     Ability to build MACH system and resolve FST issues individually     Good knowledge in HVDC Classic and Light Protection applications     Commission experience is advantageous     Good Omicron knowledge to operate, test and develop automations                 Nice to have Skills:           Experience in training a small group of personals     Engineering Base Drafting tool knowledge to design cubicle     HMI, GWS and Networking experience     Develop and test HMI solutions RTDS modelling     Exposure to System studies     MACH 3 Knowledge     Knowledge on 61850 Experience in different protocols                 Responsibility:             Control / Protection Testing:           Test the Base Classic and Light control / Protection applications and suggest improvements     Make sure that the control system / Protections works as intended for each new development releases     Use TFS to report and follow up all the testing activities                 Control / Protection Development:           Develop specific control / protection modules for the Base Classic and Light control / protection applications individually     Adapt the Base control applications to IDC test setup                 FST:           Develop the base lab setup at IDC     Green line, test and deblock the setup     Maintain the base configuration in the test setup     Resolve FST issues and provide expansion proposals etc                 Training:           Train control and protection engineers on Control / Protection base applications       Be the single point of contact for any queries on base application at IDC
column11: Training, Networking, Protection system, development testing, HMI, Control system, Design development, Install base, Testing

column2: Supporting Global RD projects by adapting the HVDC base Control and Protection software (MACH) based on the provided study reports and performing the HIL (Hardware in loop) testing in the lab environment.     Setting up and maintaining the lab environment for the different HVDC RD projects.     Developing Control and Protection solutions encompassing full development cycle (design to delivery) for the future HVDC technologies, ongoing HVDC projects and other business units.     Performing pre studies for the proposed Control and Protection ideas using EMT tools and identifying the right solutions.     Performing power system Protection studies using EMT tools based on project requirement to optimize the fault detection algorithms and setting philosophies.     Developing the automated testing solutions using secondary injection test kits to perform the protection testing in the HVDC projects to improve the quality and productivity.     Developing test cases using EMT tools for the testing of HVDC Control and Protection functions in the virtual environment.     Functional type testing of AC protection functions as per the IEC standards using secondary injection kits and real time simulation environment and get the certification done from the authorized external laboratories.     Supporting projects in resolving the issues related to Control and Protection functions.     Identifying the deviations from the technical specifications from different grid owners and proposing ideas and solutions to address the same.     Analyzing the competitor technologies to identify the gaps in our solutions and address the same to be ahead in the global market.     Suggest new improvements, which really aids our business related to Control and Protection functions.     Co-ordinating with different stake holders across the business units to get inputs to optimize the solutions for the Global HVDC projects and RD activities.       Living Hitachi Energy s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.                   Qualification Requirement           BE/BTECH in Electrical and Electronics Engineering        Knowledge and/or experiences in at least of one of the following areas: HVDC, Electric Power System Analysis, Protection Relays, Automatic Control Theory, Power System Simulation   .         Should understand different Control and Protection schematics of a HV/LV electrical substation.          Basic knowledge about communication protocols like IEC61850, MODBUS etc and SAS system.         Should have experience in developing the test cases for the Protection function testing using secondary test kits like Omicron, Doble etc        Knowledge on PSCAD, MATLAB, or any other simulation software available for electric power system and control system and RTDS, Hyper Sim, or any other electric power system simulators    is an added advantage.         Knowledge about HVDC Control and Protection system will be considered as a plus.         Automation of test cases using the python, Omicron etc scripts is an added advantage.               Soft Skills Personal Leadership          Strong communication and collaboration skills       Good intercultural sensitivity       Sense of ownership and responsibility       Training and Mentoring skills
column11: Substation, Automation, Communication protocols, Simulation, Protection system, SAS, Control system, Power transmission, MATLAB, Python

column2: We are looking for talented Windows, Linux, and macOS researchers; people who are always looking to analyze and break things while looking for a complete understanding of how they work; people who live to beat the system and challenge it, and people who are in pursuit of outsmarting malware and overcoming it to protect our customers.         What will you do       ?     Your time will be mostly focused on research and development:         Research         You ll perform cutting edge research and analyze (through reverse engineering and other methods) files, TTPs, exploits, and malwares to understand how they operate and behave. The research will mostly be based on binaries and sample files but may also be based on other types of data sources like events and behaviors.     You ll get the opportunity to work on the latest threats and malware samples to tackle sophisticated challenges of the field.     Your research findings will be used for delivering new signatures and/or shared with other detection teams to improve our products detection capabilities.     As malware research expert, you ll collaborate with many internal/external teams to form a consensus group of experts who will enhance the Detection Research using their expertise and knowledge.         Development         You ll be responsible for developing the signatures for all of our engines that will improve our detection, protection, and visibility, reaching all of our millions of endpoints across the globe.      You ll be responsible for the quality and accuracy of the deliverables that you ll create and be accountable for them.     You ll create, maintain, and improve existing infrastructure and tools that are being used by the team.       You will also be encouraged to write white papers, blogs, and articles (but only if you wish to).         What experience or knowledge should you bring         A dedication to continuous learning and skill development to meet evolving job demands.     Minimum 4 years of experience in both static and dynamic malware analysis for x86/x64 or ARM architecture.     Proficiency with reverse engineering and analysis tools, such as disassemblers, compilers, and debuggers (like IDA, Ghidra, WinDBG, SysInternals, LLDB, GDB).     Strong background in malware analysis and understanding its behavior consisting of advanced malware techniques, including but not limited to anti -tampering, defense evasion, lateral movement, ransomware, persistence, information leak.     Understanding of OS internals of at least one of Windows/Linux.     Programming experience : Assembly, C/C++, Python.     Advantages        Proficient with creating detection rules using YARA or similar engines for production use     Understanding of existing AV/EDR internals and detection mechanisms     Automation skills for handling malware detection based workflows is a plus but not mandatory.
column11: C++, Automation, Linux, Reverse engineering, X86, Windows, Medical insurance, Mac Os, WindBG, Python

column2: We invite      entry-level      researchers with an interest in      program synthesis, developer/end-user tools, and high-impact      research     to apply for a full-time position in the PROSE team at Microsoft.                 The recent success of large language models (LLMs) creates an opportunity to take a qualitative step forward, to extend dramatically the reach of what users can do with Copilots.          Our      team      provides a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of cutting-edge AI research and      real-world impact     , solving customer problems     at     a global scale     .             Researchers d     esign and carry out the research     underlying state-of-the-art systems     and work together with world-class engineers to implement these systems in production.             To learn more about our approach     and culture      see this          award talk         on the story behind      one of the team s early innovations     :     the Flash     Fill feature in Excel.                     Required     Q     ualifications                     Bachelors, Masters, or comparable experience,     in      Computer Science or      a relevant field                 Demonstrated experience      with research tasks by contributing to at least one academic paper draft, submission, or publication. Relevant tasks include collecting and analyzing      data, formulating     hypotheses, designing experiments     ,      implementing systems to validate hypotheses, report     ing     results, academic writing for conference submissions     , and presenting work to both technical and non-technical      audiences                 Experience implementing research prototypes in languages (including but not limited to) Python, C#, and Typescript                             Preferred     Qualifications                             Ability to carry out a research project, demonstrated by a submission (or ideally publication) at      a top-tier PL/SE/HCI     /ML/DB     venue (eg PLDI, OOPSLA, UIST, CHI     , AAAI,      NeurIPS     , ICML, ICLR, SIGMOD, VLDB, POPL     , FSE, ICSE, ASE,      EMNLP, NAACL, ACL,      and      comparable     )                 At least 2 years of      prior experience in Computer Science, or related fields                 Experience in training transformer-based models (including collecting and curating training data) as part of research projects in an industrial or academic setting.                 Experience working with large language models.                 Have interests in applying machine learning to structured and semi-structured data such as tabular data.                 Strong communication skills                         As an entry-level researcher, you will have the opportunity to:                     Contribute to      innovative research, under the guidance of senior researchers and engineers,     that integrate     s     various artificial intelligence technologies     and deliver     s     features for      customer-facing     Microsoft      products                 Design, implement, and experiment across     a range of domains, including data wrangling, developer tools, end-user programming     , and programming      education                 Publish in top-tier academic venues     and      interact with the broader academic community     , for example giving talks about      PROSE      research                 Collaborate with     researchers, engineers, and jointly mentor research      fellows

column2: We are Hiring for the following requirement Department: Chemical R&D Experience: 0 to 5 Years Work Location: Sanathnagar - Hyderabad Detailed Job Description Education Qualifications: PhD in Organic/Medicinal Chemistry, Chemical Biology, or a related field with 0-2 years of industry and postdoctoral experience in oligonucleotide drug discovery. Masters degree in Organic/Medicinal Chemistry, Chemical Biology, or a related field with 3-5 years of industry experience in oligonucleotide process development. Key Responsibilities: Handle process development of oligonucleotide drugs. In collaboration with the team, support oligonucleotide process development and process optimization. Support the optimization of chemistry processes for solid phase synthesis, purification, analysis of oligonucleotides and bioconjugates. Perform experiments, critically evaluate experimental data, and communicate scientific findings as presentations and written reports during weekly meetings.  Compile experimental data, write into LNB, and communicate to Reporting Manager Additional Experience and Skills : Broad experience in phosphoramidite chemistry & oligonucleotide synthesis, purification, and analytical characterization is required. Experience in handling solid phase oligonucleotide synthesizers (e.g., Oligopilot (OP)-100 etc.), AKTA pure 150 purification & TFF systems are required.  Exposure to process development of oligonucleotide APIs along with some understanding of oligonucleotide regulatory compliance is required. Excellent critical thinking, scientific skills, and ability to interpret and clearly communicate during meetings.  Strong team partner with the ability to effectively work in team. Ability to adapt to changing priorities and timelines is required.   Preferred candidate profile Postdoctoral experience with an emphasis on nucleic acid and peptide chemistry is preferred. Proven track record of accomplishments in oligonucleotide research in the form of patents, publications and/or presentations at major national meetings is preferred. Interested & Relevant experienced candidates can share their CV's at  chandrasekhar.m@natcopharma.co.in
column11: Oligonucleotide, solid phase synthesis, bioconjugates, oligonucleotide synthesis

column1: Associate or Senior Editor, Communications Earth & Environment
column2: Job Title: Associate or Senior Editor, Communications Earth & Environment Location(s):  Pune  Hybrid Working Model. Internal applicants in any journals editorial hub locations are also welcome to apply. Application Deadline: 21st April 2024, applicants will be considered as they apply. About the Role We are currently seeking an Associate or Senior Editor with experience in research to join Communications Earth & Environment - a fast-growing multidisciplinary open access journal for the Earth and environmental sciences. The journal complements our other Nature Portfolio open access titles, Nature Communications and Scientific Reports as well as the npj??. You will be responsible for selecting and preparing manuscripts for publication. You will also promote the journal?? coverage of all the fields within these broad disciplines, with a particular focus on the environmental or environmental social sciences. The position is offered on a permanent, full-time basis (starting end of April), and will be based in our New York, Pune, Beijing, Nanjing or Shanghai office (on a hybrid working basis). Internal applicants in other journals editorial hub locations are also welcome to apply. If you love science, are passionate about communication of science, and enjoy reading papers outside?your chosen area of research, you could be the person we are looking for to join the editorial team of?Communications Earth & Environment. Role Responsibilities: ??? Selection of manuscripts for publication in the journal, with the appropriate editorial oversight and within the framework of its editorial policy ??? Make those manuscripts selected for publication accessible to a wide readership, by giving attention to their titles and introductory sections, particularly the abstract, and by suggesting to the authors any structural changes that are needed. ??? Ensure that manuscripts accepted for publication are transferred to production in an appropriate, complete state.? ??? Recommend appropriate manuscripts to the Chief Editor for journal press releases and write press release drafts. ??? Recruit, train, support and keep engaged a team of external editors, ensuring that they understand an implement the philosophy and policies of the journal ??? Attend conferences and meetings and visit research institutions (in agreement with the Chief Editor) and report on these activities. ??? Advise Advertising and Marketing as required, answering questions raised and offering suggestions/leads wherever possible. ??? Devise and supply editorial content for special projects as agreed with the Chief Editor. Experience, Skills & Qualifications: ??? Research experience to PhD level (or equivalent) in one or more disciplines that fall within the environmental or environmental social sciences. However, strong candidates from all areas of the Earth and environmental sciences will be considered. ??? Editorial experience, postdoctoral experience and broad training will be an advantage. ??? A passion for science and a desire to learn more. You must be able to demonstrate the breadth of your interest in scientific research, both within and beyond your speciality. ??? The ability to read and assess the novelty, context and implications of research submitted to the journal from different disciplines. ??? Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and fluency in English (written and spoken). ??? A desire to meet scientists worldwide, online and in person, and to learn more about them and their research, and help them learn more about us and what we are looking for in the papers we seek to publish. Applicants should send: ??? a CV (including a brief account of their research and other relevant experience) ??? a research highlight in Nature style (about 150 words) on a recent paper in Communications Earth & Environment ??? and a brief cover letter explaining their interest in the post and their salary expectations.
column11: PhD Environment Science, PhD in Earth & Environment

column1: Research Specialist Environment and Sustainability ( SES )
column2: The climate change and migration research specialist will be part of an interdisciplinary team of researchers working on climate change and migration, and responsible for anchoring field engagements in Kochi. As part of the team, the incumbent s involvement will include planning and execution of fieldwork that comprises qualitative and quantitative methods with a focus on climate-induced migrations. S/he will conduct life history interviews and key informant interviews, organise workshops and stakeholder engagement activities, and build local networks. The role requires working closely with local partner/s in Kochi to coordinate field tasks.     This is a contractual position for an initial term of 11 months, renewable on mutual consent.         Activities and Tasks         Assisting with the development and implementation of research tools and instruments;         Contributing towards literature reviews and background research as needed;         Conducting field research activities as assigned, including:         Life history interviews with migrants from Odisha;         Semi-structured and in-depth interviews with key stakeholders;         Observing community dynamics, organising group discussions and facilitating meaningful dialogue;         Developing and using creative tools during multi-stakeholder events;         Maintaining detailed field notes and records of research activities; transcribing interviews;         Preparing data for analysis by cleaning, coding, and entering information into spreadsheets;         Collaborating with the IIHS Media Lab and Word Lab teams to ensure effective data collection and evidence building; create audio-visual content and develop material for wider dissemination; support website development and website updates;         Providing support in identifying the need for, and organising, workshops and stakeholder consultations at multiple locations in India;         Providing support to other IIHS activities including academics, research, training, practice, operations, and institution building at IIHS; carrying out tasks as assigned by IIHS; and travelling on IIHS work within the country as and when needed.         Structure and Reporting          The climate change and migration research specialist will be an External Consultant coordinating with the Senior Research Consultant Practice at IIHS and will be required to collaborate effectively with a diverse group of internal teams and network partners.         Person Specification       The ideal candidate should have:       A master s degree in social work, social science, development studies, rural development, environmental studies, or related discipline;         Experience in conducting qualitative and/or participatory data collection (e.g., focus group discussions) and administering quantitative household surveys;         Previous experience in working on migration and with migrant communities;         Familiarity with the Odisha state and its migratory trends, including its socio-cultural and political landscape;         Language proficiency in: Odiya, Hindi, and English.
column11: audio visual, Stakeholder Engagement, Transcription, Coding, Social science, Focus, Data collection, Research, Sustainable development, environmental studies

column2: Qualcomm's Multimedia R&D Group is seeking candidates to join its world-class Speech team developing novel technologies enabling the future of real-time communication and collaboration     We conduct fundamental research inventing new algorithms, models, and systems that allow people to engage with one another in natural ways through speech and gestures over wireless communication devices and networks     Our multi-disciplinary research spans multiple communication modalities and feeds into Qualcomm s industry-leading businesses across mobile, AR/VR, compute, IoT, and automotive     Our technologies have been incorporated into international standards and deployed in mobile devices around the world     We are seeking candidates with technical excellence in Digital Signal Processing (DSP), Machine Learning, and Speech/Audio Processing, with the creativity and initiative to apply their technical knowledge to exciting new modalities and platforms for human-to-human and human-to-machine communication                   Job Function         The selected candidate will have responsibilities in one or more of the following areas:         Fundamental research in the fields of signal processing and machine learning         Advanced use cases for human interaction that combine communication modalities from areas such as speech, audio (including 3D), natural language, video, computer vision, and graphics         Research, development, and standardization of new conversational speech codecs for wireless networks         Developing technologies for real-time communication in virtual/augmented reality and metaverse applications         Design and implementation of embedded neural network models, including model optimization & quantization         Systems level implementation and prototyping of communication systems, including live-network testing                 Skills/Experience         Strong candidates for this position will possess the following skills and experience         Experience with digital signal processing techniques including signal modeling, linear prediction, spectrum analysis and estimation, statistical signal processing, filter design and implementation, adaptive filter theory, and signal enhancement         Experience with Deep Learning, including a wide variety of architectures such as CNN, RNN, LSTM/GRU, and Transformer, plus familiarity with common toolkits such as TensorFlow or PyTorch         Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills         Programming skills in C/C++ and Python, and experience in Windows or Unix/Linux development environments         Master s degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering             The ideal candidate will further possess these additional skills and experience         Expertise in speech and audio signal processing, in domains such as speech coding, speech enhancement, automatic speech recognition (ASR), or text-to-speech (TTS) and/or neural synthesis         Experience with deep learned representations and self-supervised learning         Experience with capture, transmission, and rendering of speech and audio         Experience developing algorithms and systems for mobile voice telephony and/or voice interfaces         Embedded software development for ARM, DSP, and/or neural signal processing hardware         Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering               Keywords       Digital signal processing, DSP, machine learning, deep learning, speech processing, speech coding, speech synthesis, TTS, ASR, vocoder, telephony, VoIP, neural synthesis, speech compression, voice conversion, virtual reality, augmented reality, XR, metaverse                 Minimum Qualifications:       Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 2+ years of Systems Engineering or related work experience.    OR   Master's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field and 1+ year of Systems Engineering or related work experience.    OR   PhD in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field.

column2: As    Control Engineer / Protection Engineer    at IDC-HVDC- CONTROL PLATFORM (UB), Chennai you will be responsible for design, development, testing of Base control applications for Classic and Light HVDC system and also would be responsible to develop and maintain the base FST lab at Chennai     As a Control engineer at Base team you are expected to train the control and protection engineers and new team members on base applications and control concepts     To fulfill the current and future requirements of Hitachi s High Voltage DC (HVDC) transmission, Hitachi has developed a fully computerized control and protection system using state-of-the-art computers, micro-controllers and Digital Signal Processors connected by high performance industrial standard buses and fiber optic communication links     This system called as MACH, is the most advanced and highest performing HVDC control system in the market and has gradually evolved to an unequaled installed base around the world     To keep up with the demanding needs of HVDC customers and the market, we need to have a base for the MACH control and protection system     To be a part of this base development team one would need the skills below                 Must have Skills:           Deep Knowledge in HVDC Classic and Light Control / Protection applications     Ability to build MACH system and resolve FST issues individually     Good knowledge in HVDC Classic and Light Protection applications     Commission experience is advantageous     Good Omicron knowledge to operate, test and develop automations                 Nice to have Skills:           Experience in training a small group of personals     Engineering Base Drafting tool knowledge to design cubicle     HMI, GWS and Networking experience     Develop and test HMI solutions RTDS modelling     Exposure to System studies     MACH 3 Knowledge     Knowledge on 61850 Experience in different protocols                 Responsibility:             Control / Protection Testing:           Test the Base Classic and Light control / Protection applications and suggest improvements     Make sure that the control system / Protections works as intended for each new development releases     Use TFS to report and follow up all the testing activities                 Control / Protection Development:           Develop specific control / protection modules for the Base Classic and Light control / protection applications individually     Adapt the Base control applications to IDC test setup                 FST:           Develop the base lab setup at IDC     Green line, test and deblock the setup     Maintain the base configuration in the test setup     Resolve FST issues and provide expansion proposals etc                 Training:           Train control and protection engineers on Control / Protection base applications       Be the single point of contact for any queries on base application at IDC
column11: Training, Networking, Protection system, development testing, HMI, Control system, Design development, Install base, Testing

column2: Supporting Global RD projects by adapting the HVDC base Control and Protection software (MACH) based on the provided study reports and performing the HIL (Hardware in loop) testing in the lab environment. Developing Control and Protection solutions encompassing full development cycle (design to delivery) for the future HVDC technologies, ongoing HVDC projects and other business units.     Performing pre studies for the proposed Control and Protection ideas using EMT tools and identifying the right solutions.     Performing power system Protection studies using EMT tools based on project requirement to optimize the fault detection algorithms and setting philosophies.     Developing the automated testing solutions using secondary injection test kits to perform the protection testing in the HVDC projects to improve the quality and productivity.     Developing test cases using EMT tools for the testing of HVDC Control and Protection functions in the virtual environment.     Functional type testing of AC protection functions as per the IEC standards using secondary injection kits and real time simulation environment and get the certification done from the authorized external laboratories.     Supporting projects in resolving the issues related to Control and Protection functions.     Identifying the deviations from the technical specifications from different grid owners and proposing ideas and solutions to address the same.     Analyzing the competitor technologies to identify the gaps in our solutions and address the same to be ahead in the global market.     Suggest new improvements, which really aids our business related to Control and Protection functions.     Co-ordinating with different stake holders across the business units to get inputs to optimize the solutions for the Global HVDC projects and RD activities. Should understand different Control and Protection schematics of a HV/LV electrical substation.          Basic knowledge about communication protocols like IEC61850, MODBUS etc and SAS system. Knowledge about HVDC Control and Protection system will be considered as a plus.         Automation of test cases using the python, Omicron etc scripts is an added advantage.               Soft Skills Personal Leadership          Strong communication and collaboration skills       Good intercultural sensitivity       Sense of ownership and responsibility       Training and Mentoring skills

column1: R&D Head Downstream- Oil Palm- Listed Agrobased Group
column2: Organization:  Top 10 Listed & Reputed Agrobased MNC Group Location:  Navi Mumbai Educational Qualification: Full Time, PhD   Oils Food Technology, Chemistry, or related field (advanced degree preferred) only.   We are seeking an experienced and dynamic R&D Head to lead our downstream product development initiatives in oil palm value addition. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in handling product development teams, driving innovation, collaborating with global clients, and creating cutting-edge solutions in the food industry, particularly in the areas of cocoa butter substitutes, non-dairy cream, bakery fat, margarine, and shortenings etc. Role & responsibilities: Lead Product Development Teams:  Manage and mentor a team of skilled professionals in product development, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives and timelines. Drive Innovation:  Spearhead the development of innovative products and formulations that meet market demands and regulatory requirements, staying ahead of industry trends. Lead and collaborate with Application Teams:  Work closely with application teams to translate product concepts into tangible solutions that deliver superior performance and customer satisfaction. Co-create with Global Clients:  Engage with global clients to understand their needs, co-create customized solutions, and build lasting partnerships that drive business growth. Technology transfer:  Creation and Transfer of Product Recipes to Production Plant Ensure Quality and Compliance:  Uphold high standards of quality, safety, and regulatory compliance throughout the product development process, from concept to commercialization. Optimize Processes:  Continuously evaluate and optimize R&D processes to enhance efficiency, cost-effectiveness, and speed to market. Stay Abreast of Industry Trends:  Keep abreast of market trends, competitor activities, and technological advancements to identify new opportunities and stay competitive. Preferred candidate profile    Sound knowledge of Organic Chemistry with focus on oleochemicals and good understanding of rheological properties is required. Proven experience (15+ years) in leading R&D teams in the edible oil and value addition industry, with a focus on downstream product development Strong background in developing and commercializing products such as cocoa butter substitutes, non-dairy cream, bakery fat, margarine, and shortenings To engage with joint research to develop new and futuristic products which may be the need for leading food companies in India and outside India (for exports). Expertise in managing cross-functional teams, project management, and budgeting. Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with internal teams and external partners. Email:  pritesh.barve@weareams.com

column2: The Prison Research Rapporteur (Sr) should have a strong track record of undertaking socio-legal research to lead the research team.            JOB SUMMARY       The candidate will undertake extensive field related travel, supervise data handling and analysis, and create a body of relevant research.     The candidate is required to extensively engage with the Government officials and coordinate with stake holders, as well as vendors.     The work requires monitoring and evaluation of our Research Programs/Projects and team management.                  Post graduate degree in Social Science / Law or a relevant subject     Minimum 7 years of experience of conducting research. Excellent research skills (Quantitative and Qualitative).      Prior research experience, especially within the criminal justice system.      Criminal Justice System Understanding     Understanding of the criminal justice system and should be comfortable working in prisons, courts, police stations. Understanding of the prison system in India.     Should be aware of socio-political debates around laws. The Senior Research Rapporteur should have a deep understanding of socio-legal perspectives revolving around crime and punishment, sentencing practices, criminal justice systems.        QUALIFICATIONS EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS                   S/he should be able to articulate and assert the cause of open prisons.      Should be aware of debates revolving around laws/Acts/Bills. Working knowledge of the following is an advantage:      Indian Penal Code (IPC) and the Code of Criminal Procedure (Cr.P.C)     Indian Evidence Act The Prisoners Act, Prison Manuals. Juvenile Justice (Care and Protection of Children) Act, Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, The Trafficking of Persons (Prevention, Protection and Rehabilitation) Bill, 2018     Relevant prison related judgements and case Laws. Should have a track record of publication of research in reputed journals.
column11: Team management, Publishing, Social science, Legal, Billing, Legal research, Research, Monitoring

column1: Manager-AshankDesai Centre For Leadership & Organisational Development
column2: Ashank Desai Centre for Leadership and Organisational Development (ADCLOD) at the Indian Institute of Management Ahmedabad (IIMA), set up with support from Mr Ashank Desai (an IIM Alumnus, Founder and former Chairman,  Mastek ), seeks to make a distinctive contribution to knowledge about Leadership and Organisational Development through cutting-edge research in the areas of leadership practice for knowledge organisations, non-governmental organisations and public sector organisations. The center aims to develop and embrace newer leadership capabilities, models and frameworks and engage in knowledge dissemination on the same through training, advisory services, annual summits, speaker sessions, and newsletters. ADCLOD is looking for a Manager who will manage the centre, execute the programs, develop the brand, and provide overall administrative leadership. Job   Description: The Manager shall report to the Chairperson, Ashank Desai Centre for Leadership and Organisational Development. Some of the responsibilities of the position include: ??Develop management systems, administrative structures and processes for ADCLOD that are in consonance with IIMA policies. ??Provide logistical support to IIMA faculty members and help generate high impact intellectual capital through research projects. ??Work closely with Centre Chairperson and IIMA administration to conceptualize and organise events such as conferences, workshops, symposia, and panels involving academics, professionals, and policymakers. ??Work with key actors in the leadership space to develop avenues for research, training, and advisory engagement for IIMA faculty members. ??Develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders in government, industry and academic partner institutions. ??Manage public relations and outreach through the website and social media activities of ADCLOD.   Qualification,   Experience   &   Skill   Requirements: ??Postgraduate degree in any discipline, but preferably in management, organisational behaviour, human resource management, strategic management, or public administration from a reputed institution. Candidates with a PhD degree in the relevant areas may also apply. ??Industry managers interested in working in an academic setting and contributing to leadership knowledge creation and dissemination can also apply. ??A minimum of 7 years of professional experience with demonstrable evidence of exceptional performance and fit with the current position. ??Excellent networking and communication skills. ??Business development, fundraising, and the ability to build relationships with senior policy makers and industry professionals. Age:  Maximum 45 years as on the last date of Application. The institute provides age relaxation as per GOI rules. Additional 5 years age relaxation is given to women candidates. Salary   &   Allowances:  Selected candidate will be offered an appointment on a Tenure Based Scaled Contract for a fixed term of three years, which may be extended for a further period as required. Based on the experience and qualification, the selected candidate will be placed in Pay Level 10 under the pay matrix of 7th Central Pay Commission. Besides the salary as per the 7th CPC, the Institute offers other benefits which are at par with the permanent employees. To apply please visit the link  https://www.iima.ac.in/the-institute/administration/working-with-us  and select the respective position latest by  June 26 ,2024.
column11: Management Skills, Research And Development, Administrative Skills
